website_summaries.verdict: With poor indoor white balance, soft images, and sluggish performance, it's best to give this camera a pass.
cons: Shoddy incandescent white balance and complete automation mean severely yellow indoor photos

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed as I need a camera as I am a ...
customer_reviews.text: It appears the camera is defective. Does not expose photos as it should. I owned same model before so I am familiar with how it should work, I called Olympus to see if I could have them repair the camera, but they no longer have parts. I guess I need to return to seller. I went through manual, tried all things manual suggested but pictures taken in natural light are extremely light and not suitable for my purposes. I am very disappointed as I need a camera as I am a realtor.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: present camera broke. Could not retrieve pictures. This camera works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sternitzke

customer_reviews.title: Good camera - purchased used.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera used to replace my original one which was damaged when I dropped it. This used one is actually in better shape than my originakl one. Good vender.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Haehnle

customer_reviews.title: Olympus FE 210
customer_reviews.text: For such a small package this is a versatile, easy to use camera. The image stabilization really helps since one can easily move when snapping. The extra zoom feature enables good closeups and images are easy to transfer to the PC. Seems to use battery power economically too.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Twain

customer_reviews.title: Olympus FE-210 camera
customer_reviews.text: I like the Olympus 210 camera, easy to use and takes good photos, I liked it so much, I bought this one for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy

customer_reviews.title: all scratched up
customer_reviews.text: camera took three weeks to arrive. front of camera all scratched up looked like it had been slid on the pavement ,also the battery door seems loose witch worries us. wished we had just spent the extra money for a new one insted of buying used.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Varney

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a "battery empty" problem. It doesn't matter how many new batteries you buy, it will continue giving the same message. I bought the camera because of the brand, but this is the last Olympus camera I will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: JC Valdes

customer_reviews.title: Good camera.
customer_reviews.text: Did a good job in the heat and humidity of the Peleliu jungle. Great value for the price paid. I chose the FE-210 for its small size and simplicity of operation.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pictures
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very simple and easy to use.I would have liked to have a built in Microphone in the camera since you can take short movies with it. The camera is light weight and small easy to take along wherever you go.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Landenber

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good camera with all the features you need, and easy to use and giving you a superior quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Garcia

customer_reviews.title: used olympus
customer_reviews.text: it worked almost like new but had 1 to 2 pictures from previous owner.other than that it was operating so i could not really delete all the old pic,s
customer_reviews.author: bobs static focus

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied. Thank you.
customer_reviews.text: This camera was very needed and indeed in great shape. We are using it and love it. We are very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bermea

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, yet not good either...
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes pictures okay, but it eats through AA batteries, whether alkaline or rechargeable, alive. I use it indoors only, and with an AC adaptor as shown. It will take an image of a jet-black surface easier than my older camera, a Minolta DiMAGE F100, but that's all I can really say about that. The quality of the Minolta's images, of course, are superior. In addition, whenever it's turned on you have to cancel that annoying set-date-and-time screen that pops up, every time, and before you can start using it. Lastly, ISO settings are non-existent, and for a 7.1 MP camera at that. In the end, I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Starflower

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital camera that wasn't a hand-me-down from my dad. I love this little thing! The only real problem I have is that the battery life isn't very good. I can usually get about 50 pictures before I have to change batteries. I would recommend using a high-quality rechargeable battery with this camera or you'll go through AA's fast. Even though it's only got a measely 7.1 megapixels, the photos it takes are awesome, super high quality. It's small so it's super portable. I would totally recommend this camera, even if just for someone getting their first digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Less is not always more
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not recommended. Main problem: It's simply too slow to be of any use - the delay betwen pressing the shutter button and the camera actually taking the shot makes this camera next to useless. We took this to Six Flags and I took shots of the dolphin show which were useless as the camera cannot operate fast enough even in bright sunlight. I have replaced this with a Fuji z5 which is better in every respect. (..and don't get me started on the pointlessness of 'feature' that allows you to shoot movies without sound...)
customer_reviews.author: uktravailer

customer_reviews.title: Cantankerous little toy
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have brand new Duracell or Energizer batteries in there, it will likely say "Empty Battery" and shut down. Since rechargeable batteries have slightly lower voltage, you will not get very far with it, or be continually charging batteries. Testing out the batteries with a tester and have the dial rate them Good and/or green is not good enough for this little pest. It may be a defective sensor, but I have a feeling this new camera will be in a landfill before the week is out. Back to 35mm. It have served me well for 25 years.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Poor photo image quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a dead Canon Powershot A70 3.2 mega P's. And guess what .. the old Canon has better quality photos. Clearer, sharper, plain better. I got this at a bargain price .. I'll give it to my wife and do some serious looking and review reading. I didn't want more mega P's I've never printed larger than 8 by 10 and 3.2 megas dealt with that OK.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Very bad
customer_reviews.text: No microphone (when recording video). Also battery problems. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Verox

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: This camera, while inexpensive is not worth buying, here's why. Basically, having owned several digicams before, this camera is slow. Aperture is not large enough and the flash blows out peoples faces. IF you need a camera for taking still shots outside, I guess this will be OK
customer_reviews.author: K. Morley

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Even with lights turned on in the house AND flash..the photos come out dark and very "noisy" or pixelated...even while shooting on the highest quality. I thought I could trust a brand like Olympus but I'm sooo unhappy with this camera. I hate it; I suggest you save your money and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kinga

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was cheap and it had good reviews on CNET. I am generally satisifed. The only problems I have are the slow shutter speed and the quality of zoomed-in images. To all the people who are whining about no sound recording, 1. do some research and check out the specs on CNET, and 2. PAY MORE MONEY IF YOU WANT MORE FEATURES!
customer_reviews.author: Mike F.

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Some people have complained about the image quality but i think its good for the money i paid. PLease dont compare this camera with others like Olympus Ultra zoom, they are in different categories. CONS: The bad thing on this camera NO AUDIO IN VIDEO MODE. PROS:-VERY EASY TO USE -Low price -It can be carry in a pants pocket
customer_reviews.author: Moises!

customer_reviews.title: DON'T DO IT......NO AUDIO
customer_reviews.text: This camera has no audio so every video that I've recorded has NO SOUND!!! That's the dumbest thing I've ever heard (NO PUN INTENDED!). What's the point of having the movie feature if there's no microphone to record the sound??!! I recorded my daughter's 3 rd birthday and I'm absolutely upset that there is no way for me to recapture any of those moments. Buy a different camera. AND the only way to take pictures is by using the screen so the battery has to be recharged frequently.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kilpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer needs better disclosure!
customer_reviews.text: This camera was brought to replace a Sony 3.1 mega-pixel. This camera is horrible and has the nerve to display a "movie recorder" as one of it's "features" but has NO SOUND! What a waste of money. Get something better.
customer_reviews.author: Pretty In Lou

customer_reviews.title: No sound!
customer_reviews.text: You'll be very disappointed like me if you get your movies back from your children's music program, only to discover the camera didn't have sound. I suppose I should've noticed, but it was sold with comparable models which did record sound, and some quite well. There's a reason things are cheap. Picture quality is OK but it really eats batteries - very obvious difference from other Olympus & Nikon cameras of similar type.
customer_reviews.author: Nakaale

customer_reviews.title: FE-210 "Battery empty" Problem
customer_reviews.text: Bought and returned FE-210 today...after 2 sets of tested good NiMH batteries kicked up "Battery empty" error messages. A quick Google search showed problem is ubiquitous. This will be my last Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: BobR

customer_reviews.title: A serious Battery problem...
customer_reviews.text: As many others have said, this model and several other Olympus cameras have a problem that renders it unusable. I had the typical "Battery Empty" problem. I contacted Olympus service, downloaded an "update" , then the camera quit entirely. The next step is send it in. With no warranty it is not worth any repair charge. Customer service left a lot to be desired as well. With plenty of other choices this camera/brand is not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I really should have rated this camera "0" stars. First of all, there is a big lag time between the moment you press the shutter and the time that it takes a picture. Secondly, unless you use the stabilization feature, your pictures are almost always gonna come out blurry. The stabilization feature makes the pictures come out grainy. Please don't make the same mistake that I made.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Slick camera. Very good picture quality, many options, small and light weight, very nice software that comes with the camera. Battery life is somewhat average, so stock up on some rechargeable AA's.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: No sound on video!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fine if you want to just take pictures. Very nice pictures. Two problems. 1. No rechargeable battery. I bought some rechargeable AA batteries and that has worked OK. 2. This is a BIG problem. The video has NO SOUND. What's the point of shooting video without sound? Just terrible. I would not recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Live Up To Standards
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a 3MP Olympus for years and really like it so I went with Olympus again. These 7MP pictures aren't as clear as my older camera, especially indoors. I did want a smaller, lighter camera and I did get that. I do like the size and I definitely wanted one that took AA batteries so it will work for me since I just am a very amateur photographer but for those who take it more seriously I would go with something else.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Buggy and Awkward in Use
customer_reviews.text: The companion image editing software is disappointing, feature-wise, and has already crashed my (WinXP) system once. The camera itself seems to have buggy firmware as well, though I haven't fully invested the time to learn every nuance of its operations, so in fact it may just have a crummy user interface (as opposed to bugs).
customer_reviews.author: Eric W. Sirko

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: This camera is awful. The shutter is extremely slow and for a 7+ MP camera, the picture quality leaves a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Why does everyone hate this camera?
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, why does everyone hate this camera? I've never noticed any bad picture quality. I admit there is some motion blur, but don't most cameras have that?
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: WooHoo
customer_reviews.text: My first foray into digital photography, and it's great. Takes some getting used to not having a miniscule viewfinder to squint into, but great. Looking forward to the summer, travel and lots of pics to download. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jarett R. Smithwrick

customer_reviews.title: Olympus Stylus FE-210
customer_reviews.text: This is my second digital camara, same brand, same model both of them for gifts. This is amazing quality and excelent price. The only concern is that it doesn't have the way to do short videos with sound. Regards
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Romero Vega

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This item is perfect for the beginner. Its pretty freakin great pictures. Have a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Faten Souid

product_meta.title: Olympus Stylus FE-210 7MP Digital Camera with Digital Image Stabilized 3x Optical Zoom
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Digital photography made easy! Built-in help guides, one-touch operations, preset scene modes, and a large LCD are just a few of the features that make using the FE-210 simple and fun. 

 Stylus FE-210 Highlights 

 7.1 megapixels The FE-210s high-resolution CCD delivers superior image quality for larger prints without sacrificing detail. 

 Built-in help guides Learn as you go. A brief description of camera settings and features can be conveniently displayed on the LCD at the push of a button. 

 Shooting guide Let the camera do it all! You just need to select the type of shot or effect you want and the shooting guide will automatically adjust the cameras settings for you. 

 16 shooting modes including Movie Getting the best shot has never been easier! Preset shooting modes optimize the cameras settings for any shooting situation to ensure you capture a great shot. Select Scene Modes such as Portrait, Landscape, Night Scene, Sports and more. Records TV-quality AVI movies (640 x 480 resolution at 15fps) up to the capacity of your xD card. 

 Digital image stabilization Freeze the action! With high ISO sensitivity and faster shutter speeds, you can capture sharp, blur-free images, even if you or your subject is moving. 

 2.5-inch LCD The large, bright LCD (154,000 pixels) provides easy shooting and sharing of your images with friends and family. 

 3x optical zoom The precision-crafted Olympus lens delivers sharper, clearer images and brings you closer to the action without taking a step. 

 My Favorites Always keep your favorite memories with you! This in-camera album allows you to store up to 9 of your favorite images to share with friends and family anytime -- using a minimal amount of memory. 

 One-touch easy print Prints at the click of a button. Simply, connect your camera to any PictBridge-enabled printer. No computer necessary.
feature_bullets: 7.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 15 x 20-inch prints
3x optical zoom with Digital Image Stabilization Mode; 2.5-inch LCD display
My Favorites feature for easy access to popular pictures
One-Touch Easy Print mode with PictBridge-enabled printers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars58 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
